Hi Jan, it might help you get a better response if you provide a little s=
ummary of the experimental setup and how you envisioned it working, for exa=
mple including how the substrate is set up and the input and output geometr=
ies.  That might make it easier for us to consider your domain than reading=
 code specifically.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jan van der Lugt <ja=
nlugt@...> wrote:
>
> Dear all,
> 
> For a while now I have tried to make a=
 HyperNEAT experiment to do
> classification tasks, but I can't seem to get=
 it learning right. The
> accuracy just does not improve beyond a certain v=
alue 0.655222, which is the
> percentage of benign tumors in the dataset. E=
ssentially, the algorithm is a
> ZeroR classifier... Can anybody spot my mi=
stake? Hope so!
> 
> Regards,
> Jan
>
